contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox football club |clubname = Umeå IK |image = [[Image:Umea IK.png]] |caption = |fullname = Umeå Idrottsklubb |nickname = UIK |shortname = |founded = 1917<ref name=ne /> |ground = [[Gammliavallen]], [[Umeå]]<ref name=ne /> |capacity = 10,000 |owntitle = |owner = |chairman = Erik Orring |manager = Joakim Blomqvist |kit manufacturer = |main sponsor = |league = [[Damallsvenskan]] |season = |position = |website = http://umeaik.se/ |pattern_la1=|pattern_b1=_thinyellowsides|pattern_ra1= |leftarm1=000000|body1=000000|rightarm1=000000|shorts1=000000|socks1=000000 |pattern_la2=|pattern_b2=_thinyellowsides|pattern_ra2= |leftarm2=ffffff|body2=ffffff|rightarm2=ffffff|shorts2=ffffff|socks2=ffffff |American = }} '''Umeå IK''' is a prominent women's [[association football]] club based in the city of [[Umeå]], [[Sweden]]. The club was established in 1917 as a general sports club, and started competing in women's in 1985. In 1996 the team reached the premier division, the [[Damallsvenskan]] but was relegated the following year. In 1998 they got promoted again and since then stayed in the league. Umeå IK has won seven Swedish championships (2000, 2001, 2002, 2005, 2006, 2007 and 2008), and they have also won the [[UEFA Women's Champions League]] twice, in 2003 and 2004, and were runners up in 2002, 2007 and 2008. Umeå IK play their home games at [[Gammliavallen]] Stadium in [[Umeå]]. The team colours are black and yellow. The club is affiliated to the [[Västerbottens Fotbollförbund]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://svenskfotboll.se/svensk-fotboll/om-svff/distrikten/?ffid=20 |title=Kontaktuppgifter och tävlingar - Västerbottens Fotbollförbund |publisher=[[Swedish Football Association]] |accessdate=18 December 2011}}</ref> == Honours == * '''[[Damallsvenskan|Championship]]'''<ref name=ne>{{cite encyclopedia |title=Umeå IK |encyclopedia=[[Nationalencyklopedin]] |language=Swedish |url=http://www.ne.se/umeå-ik |accessdate=18 December 2011}} {{subscription required}}</ref> ** '''Champion (7): ''' 2000, 2001, 2002, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008 * '''[[UEFA Women's Champions League]]'''<ref name=ne /> ** '''Winners (2): ''' [[2002–03 UEFA Women's Cup|2003]], [[2003–04 UEFA Women's Cup|2004]] ** '''Runners-up (3)''' [[2001–02 UEFA Women's Cup|2002]], [[2006–07 UEFA Women's Cup|2007]], [[2007–08 UEFA Women's Cup|2008]] == Current squad == As of 24 May 2013 {{Fs start}} {{Fs
